page.title: 07PADDOCKHURST ESTATE II
page.content: A{game reserve}rears four and a half thousand{pheasants}with a small amount of{partridge.}In each season of ten Saturday shoots an average of 150 pheasants are shot in a day. The{wildlife}of the forest is varied. There are four species of {deer;}fallow, sika, muntjac and roe. Badger, fox, mink, hare and rabbit also inhabit the woods. The trees are homes for Dutch and Little Owl, also many{birds of prey;}kestrel, hobby and sparrow hawks, jays and magpies. Found to the south of the forest is a{disused quarry}now being used as a {police rifle range. Mount Noddy,}a name which appears on the map, is thought to be a relic of the past{iron {industry.
